item.title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing news: How railway police zeroed in on suspect in train - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Suspect Detained by Railway Police

Date & Source: Jan 18, 2025, Hindustan Times

The Railway Protection Force (RPF) detained a suspect in the Saif Ali Khan stabbing case while he was travelling by the Jnaneswari Express train in Durg district, Chhattisgarh.

  • The suspect, Aakash Kanojia, was located using information from the Mumbai police.
  • Kanojia was apprehended in the train's general coach based on a photo and tower location provided by the Mumbai police.
  • Saif Ali Khan was attacked in his home, resulting in multiple stab wounds.
  • He was treated at Lilavati Hospital and is reported to be out of danger.
  • The Mumbai police have assembled over 20 teams to find the intruder who attacked Khan.
"The suspect's identity was confirmed through a video call with Mumbai Police. He has been detained. Further interrogation will be done by Mumbai Police." - Sanjay Sinha, RPF in-charge at Durg

The swift action by the RPF showcases the effective collaboration between state police forces in the wake of a serious incident involving a public figure.

item.title: Centre forms inter-ministerial team to probe mysterious deaths in J-Ks Rajouri - The Tribune India
item.description:
Centre forms inter-ministerial team to probe mysterious deaths in Jammu's Rajouri

Date: Recent; Source: The Tribune

The Central Government has formed an inter-ministerial team to investigate 15 mysterious deaths in Badhaal village, Jammu and Kashmir, over the past month and a half.

  • The team, led by the Union Home Ministry, will include experts from various ministries.
  • The goal is to determine the cause of deaths and provide immediate relief and preventive measures.
  • Symptoms among victims included vomiting and loss of consciousness.
  • The Jammu and Kashmir Health Minister has stated that all tests have ruled out any mysterious disease.
“All tests conducted both within and outside the Union Territory have shown negative results.” - Sakeena Masood

This investigation highlights ongoing health concerns in the region and the need for thorough examination of the events leading to these fatalities.

item.title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: Judgment today by Kolkata court, victim's kin say ‘more involved’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
RG Kar rape case verdict: BJP alleges evidence was 'tampered'

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 18, 2025, a court in Kolkata found Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape-murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor, whose body was discovered in the RG Kar Medical College & Hospital seminar hall on August 9, 2024. The ruling has raised concerns over the investigation, with allegations of evidence tampering from various political representatives.

  • The body of a trainee doctor was found dead in RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer, was arrested shortly after the incident, following CCTV footage linking him to the crime.
  • The case led to widespread protests by junior doctors demanding justice and better safety measures.
  • The trial began on November 12, 2024, with a total of 50 witnesses presented.
“The court has convicted him (Sanjay Roy), but the people of West Bengal believe that more than one person may have been involved in the incident.” - Sukanta Majumdar, Union Minister

The court is set to determine Sanjay Roy's sentence on January 20, 2025, amidst calls from the public for the maximum possible punishment.

item.title: Sanjay Roy convicted in RG Kar case: What happens next, what punishment he may get - The Times of India
item.description:
Sanjay Roy convicted in RG Kar case: What happens next, what punishment he may get

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

In a significant legal development, Sanjay Roy has been convicted in the RG Kar case, raising questions about the potential punishments he may face.

  • The conviction is a notable outcome of the ongoing judicial proceedings.
  • Possible sentences include imprisonment and fines, reflecting the severity of the offenses.
  • The case highlights ongoing legal challenges within the system and its implications for justice.
“This conviction represents a step forward in the pursuit of justice in complex cases,” legal experts say.

As the legal process unfolds, it remains to be seen what specific penalties will be imposed on Roy, but the case reiterates the importance of accountability in public service.

item.title: No Fish, Meat Or Any Non-Veg Food To Be Sold In Bengaluru's Yelahanka For A Month | Here's Why - News18
item.description:
No Fish, Meat Or Any Non-Veg Food To Be Sold In Bengaluru's Yelahanka For A Month | Here's Why

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: News18

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has announced a prohibition on the sale of meat, fish, and non-vegetarian items in a 13 km radius around Air Force Station Yelahanka from January 23 to February 17, 2025, due to the upcoming Aero India 2025 airshow.

  • The prohibition aims to prevent bird strikes during airplane practice sessions.
  • The event will occur from February 10 to 14, featuring various aviation displays.
  • Any violations of the prohibition will face penalties under local regulations.

Karnataka | Aero India-2025 show will be held at Airforce station Yelahanka from Feb 10 to 14. Due to this, sale of non-veg food is prohibited within 13 km radius of the Airforce station from Jan 23 to Feb 17: BBMP pic.twitter.com/aiDFzkdVOl— ANI (@ANI) January 18, 2025

This year's Aero India will bring together international and local firms to explore partnerships in the aerospace sector.

item.title: Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery Result 2025 LIVE Updates: Winner for 1st prize Rs 10 cr JACKPOT OUT - Check other winning numbers online, offline - ET Now
item.description:
Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery Result 2025 LIVE Updates: Winners list OUT!

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: ET Now News

The Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery has announced its results today, revealing the winners of various prize categories. The lottery is celebrated alongside major Indian festivals and draws significant public attention.

  • The 1st prize winner has claimed a JACKPOT of Rs 10 crore with the number B5 66370.
  • 2nd prize winner: Rs 1 crore, winning number: A5 81656.
  • 3rd prize winner: Rs 50 lakh, winning number: B3 25586.
  • 4th prize winners include several ticket numbers, with a prize of Rs 10 lakh.
  • The lottery results can be checked online or through local newspapers.
"The draw will take place under the supervision of the Punjab State Lottery Department, ensuring transparency in the lottery process."

This event draws large participation and excitement among the public, marking it as one of the most anticipated lotteries of the year.

item.title: Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery 2025 Live Updates: Rs 10 crore JACKPOT for 1st prize - Winners list to be OUT at 8 PM | How to check online & offline - ET Now
item.description:
Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery Result 2025 LIVE Updates

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: ET Now News

The Punjab State Lohri Makar Sankranti Bumper Lottery 2025 has unveiled its winners, with the 1st prize amounting to Rs 10 crores. This lottery is celebrated in conjunction with the major festivals Lohri and Makar Sankranti, making it a highly anticipated event.

  • The draw takes place under the supervision of the Punjab State Lottery Department, ensuring transparency.
  • The winners list for the lottery was announced at 8 PM on January 18.
  • The lottery is well-known for its generous cash prizes and high levels of public participation.
1st prize winning number for JACKPOT Rs 10 crore: B5 66370

Punjab State Lottery offers a variety of prizes, including 2nd prize of Rs 1 crore, 3rd prize of Rs 50 lakh, and multiple other categories. The prize claiming process requires verification and submission of necessary documents.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan stabbed: How cops managed to nab suspect in Chhattisgarh - The Times of India
item.description:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbed: How Cops Managed to Nab Suspect in Chhattisgarh

Publication Date: Not available Source: Not available

Saif Ali Khan was reportedly stabbed in an incident that prompted a swift response from local law enforcement, resulting in the capture of the suspect.

  • Incident occurred in Chhattisgarh involving Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan.
  • Police rapidly mobilized to track down the suspect.
  • Details surrounding the motive of the stabbing are still unclear.
  • Community response has been one of shock and concern over safety.
"The community is shaken by this violent act against a public figure."

The incident has raised questions about safety and security for celebrities and public figures in similar situations.

item.title: BJP's Parvesh Verma claims Arvind Kejriwal ordered driver to crush 3 youths, refutes AAP's 'attack' charge - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP's Parvesh Verma claims Arvind Kejriwal ordered driver to crush 3 youths, refutes AAP's 'attack' charge

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

BJP leader Parvesh Verma has refuted claims made by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) regarding an attack on Arvind Kejriwal's vehicle during a campaign. He instead alleges that Kejriwal ordered his driver to run over three youths who were protesting.

  • Verma claims the vehicle hit three unemployed youths protesting against Kejriwal.
  • AAP stated that Kejriwal was attacked by BJP supporters during his campaigning.
  • Verma plans to file a police report for attempted murder over the incident.
  • The AAP is urging the Election Commission to take action against the BJP for alleged violence.
  • The Delhi assembly election is scheduled for February 5, 2025.
“Arvind Kejriwal signalled the driver to crush them... This is an attempt to murder.” - Parvesh Verma

The conflict illustrates rising tensions in the lead-up to the Delhi elections, with both parties making serious allegations against each other.

item.title: S Jaishankar on Pakistan: ‘Cancer of terrorism now consuming its body politic’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
S Jaishankar on Pakistan: ‘Cancer of terrorism now consuming its body politic’

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

External affairs minister S Jaishankar, during the 19th Nani A Palkhivala Memorial Lecture, discussed strained ties with Pakistan attributed to its support for cross-border terrorism. He emphasized that this “cancer” is now affecting Pakistan’s political landscape.

  • Jaishankar highlighted India's role in supporting smaller neighbors through non-reciprocal initiatives.
  • Pakistan is characterized as the exception in India's neighborhood due to its terrorism-related policies.
  • India's assistance during crises, including a significant financial package to Sri Lanka during the pandemic, exemplifies India's commitment to its neighbors.
  • Jaishankar noted the importance of addressing mutual interests to maintain stability in the region.
“Pakistan remains the exception in our neighbourhood in view of its support for cross-border terrorism, and that cancer is now consuming its own body politic.” - S Jaishankar

Jaishankar's comments underline the evolving geopolitical landscape in South Asia amid growing tensions with Pakistan.

item.title: Ousted From Juna Akhada? IIT Baba Makes Abrupt Exit From Maha Kumbh - News18
item.description:
IIT Baba's Sudden Departure from Maha Kumbh Raises Concerns

Date: January 18, 2025, Source: News18

The once-popular 'IIT Baba', Abhey Singh, abruptly exited the Maha Kumbh Mela, generating significant concern among his followers. His disappearance follows a series of media interactions that contributed to growing mental stress.

  • Abhey Singh, known for his transition from aerospace engineering to spirituality, left the Maha Kumbh and Juna Akhada.
  • His family and ashram sadhus are worried as he has been unreachable and cut off contact.
  • Reports suggest mental stress and drug use contributed to his decision to leave.
  • The Juna Akhada's strict media protocols may have led to friction over Singh's rising popularity.
  • Singh has previously expressed his journey from engineering to seeking deeper spiritual meaning.
“You will keep searching for the meaning of life. I used to find that in engineering but never found my answers,” said Singh.

Abhey Singh's sudden decision raises questions about the pressures faced by public figures in spiritual communities, warranting a call for more support and understanding.

item.title: 8th Pay Commission gets govt nod: What changes were made by 6th and 7th pay panels? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
8th Pay Commission gets govt nod: What changes were made by 6th and 7th pay panels?

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

On January 15, Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced that the 8th Pay Commission has been approved and is expected to be implemented in 2026, following the necessary revisions of salaries for central government employees and pensioners.

  • The commission is set to replace the current 7th Pay Commission, which has been in effect since 2016.
  • The 7th Pay Commission established a fitment factor of 2.57 and set a minimum basic salary of ₹18,000 per month.
  • The 6th Pay Commission raised the minimum basic salary to ₹7,000 per month and the minimum pension to ₹3,500.
  • The announcement was made just ahead of the upcoming Union Budget on February 1.
“The recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are likely to be implemented in 2026.” - Ashwini Vaishnaw

This recent decision is important as it will affect over one crore government employees and pensioners, ensuring their salaries are reviewed and potentially increased in line with inflation and economic conditions.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal’s car attacked by BJP workers during campaigning, alleges AAP; BJP denies involvement - The Hindu
item.description:
Arvind Kejriwal's Car Allegedly Attacked by BJP Workers During Campaigning

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The AAP reported an incident where Arvind Kejriwal's vehicle was allegedly attacked during a campaign rally, with claims of BJP worker involvement.

  • AAP released video evidence showing attacks on Kejriwal's car.
  • BJP denies responsibility, claiming it was a peaceful protest.
  • Two individuals were reportedly injured in the incident.
  • The incident raises tension between AAP and BJP ahead of elections.
“Supporters of BJP’s New Delhi candidate Parvesh Verma attacked Kejriwal during campaigning in the constituency,” an AAP leader said.

The confrontation adds to the already heightened political climate as elections approach.

item.title: Dalmia Cement ordered to suspend operations at power plant in Odisha after mishap - OTV News
item.description:
Dalmia Cement Ordered to Suspend Operations at Power Plant in Odisha After Mishap

Publication Date: January 16, 2023 Source: OTV News

Dalmia Cement has been ordered to suspend operations at its KP power plant due to safety concerns following a tragic incident where three workers died after a coal hopper collapsed.

  • The Deputy Director of Factories and Boilers has mandated the shutdown until necessary safety measures are implemented.
  • The tragedy occurred on January 16, with three workers losing their lives in Rajgangpur, Sundargarh district.
  • Abhimanyu Majhi, the Additional District Magistrate, confirmed that the plant will remain closed until compliance issues are addressed.
  • Authorities highlight the importance of maintaining stringent safety protocols to prevent further incidents.
“Deputy Director of Factories and Boilers has already ordered the closure of the plant... Necessary actions will be taken against the persons who will be found faulty,” said Majhi.

This closure emphasizes the need for industries to prioritize worker safety and adhere to high operational standards.

item.title: Nitish Kumar government's caste survey was to fool Bihar: Rahul Gandhi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi Critiques Nitish Kumar's Caste Survey as Deceptive

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, has alleged that the caste survey conducted by the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar was simply aimed at misleading the populace.

  • Gandhi asserts that a nationwide caste census is crucial for understanding the participation of OBCs, Dalits, and other communities in various sectors.
  • He criticized the Bihar government's caste survey as inadequate and merely a tool to fool the people.
  • During his address, Gandhi highlighted issues regarding wealth distribution and power dynamics, suggesting that while representation has been given, power remains concentrated in the hands of a few.
“When I meet the BJP MPs who belong to the backward community, Dalits, tribals, they say that we have been put in a cage.”

In conclusion, Gandhi's remarks underscore the ongoing debate over caste representation and governance in India, calling for transparency and accountability in the political process.

item.title: BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination From New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases, Assets - News18
item.description:
BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination from New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases and Asset Discrepancies

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: News18

The BJP has filed a complaint challenging the nomination of Arvind Kejriwal for the New Delhi Assembly seat, citing income discrepancies, failure to disclose criminal cases, and voter registration issues.

  • The complaint was filed by BJP candidate Parvesh Verma.
  • Allegations include incorrect income figures reported in Kejriwal's affidavits for the years 2019-2023.
  • Concerns were raised regarding Kejriwal’s voter registration, which reportedly appears in multiple locations.
  • The complaint also highlights four FIRs against Kejriwal that were not disclosed.
  • Delhi Assembly elections for all 70 constituencies are scheduled for February 5, with results on February 8.
“I have filed the nomination. I would like to tell the people of Delhi that please vote for work...” - Arvind Kejriwal

This challenge to Kejriwal’s nomination comes at a critical time as the Delhi Assembly elections approach, raising questions about the eligibility and transparency of political candidates.

item.title: Delhi Polls: Kejriwal Announces 'Gamechanger' Free Electricity, Water Scheme For Tenants - News18
item.description:
Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

With the Delhi Assembly elections approaching, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal announced a significant policy guaranteeing free electricity and water for tenants, aiming to support his party's electoral campaign.

  • Kejriwal guaranteed free electricity and water for all tenants if AAP is re-elected.
  • The announcement is particularly aimed at benefiting Purvanchali residents, who represent a significant tenant population.
  • He emphasized the current inequalities faced by tenants who do not receive similar benefits as homeowners.
  • This announcement comes on the heels of BJP's manifesto release, pushing AAP to bolster their campaign promises.
“Across Delhi, we have provided free electricity and water to residents. However, it is unfortunate that tenants do not get these benefits.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This scheme reflects AAP's continued focus on welfare initiatives, especially for vulnerable communities as they seek to secure votes in the upcoming elections.

item.title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: CBI demands maximum punishment for Sanjay Roy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Demands Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The RG Kar rape case has concluded with the court finding accused Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor. A significant outcry followed the case, leading to nationwide protests for justice.

  • The victim was discovered dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024, after being raped.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested after police identified him via a Bluetooth device found near the crime scene.
  • The case fueled widespread protests by junior doctors demanding better security measures in hospitals.
  • The trial commenced on November 12 with Judge Anirban Das overseeing proceedings that involved 50 witnesses and concluded on January 9.
The CBI's lawyer stated, “We demanded maximum possible punishment for Sanjay Roy.”

The case has raised significant concerns over safety in medical facilities and the need for more robust legal actions against such heinous crimes.

item.title: Magic mushroom not a narcotic substance under NDPS Act: Kerala High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Magic mushroom not a narcotic substance under NDPS Act: Kerala High Court

Published on: 18 Jan 2025, 11:36 am | Source: Kerala High Court

The Kerala High Court has ruled that magic mushrooms are not scheduled narcotic substances under the NDPS Act, impacting the legal standing of a man accused of possession.

  • The court observed that magic mushrooms, while containing psilocybin, do not qualify as narcotics.
  • This ruling influences how quantities of drugs are assessed for bail eligibility.
  • The judgment aligns with previous High Court decisions from Karnataka and Madras.
"Magic mushrooms cannot be treated as a mixture. Therefore, Note 4 of the Table dealing with small quantity and commercial quantity is not applicable." - Justice Kunhikrishnan

The court noted that the substance found in the accused's possession did not constitute a commercial quantity, leading to a grant of bail.
